name: AlmLabEnvPrepareTask
friendlyName: UFT One ALM Lab Environment Preparation
description: Use this build step to assign values to AUT Environment Configuration in ALM.
author: Micro Focus

inputs.name: varAlmserv
inputs.label: ALM Server
inputs.helpMarkDown: The address of your ALM server, in the format http:s//(ALM server name):(port)/qcbin

inputs.name: varUserName
inputs.label: Username
inputs.helpMarkDown: The username that will access this ALM server during the build step run

inputs.name: varPass
inputs.label: Password
inputs.helpMarkDown: The password for the user that will access this ALM server during the build step run

inputs.name: varDomain
inputs.label: Domain
inputs.helpMarkDown: The ALM domain in which the tests to run are stored

inputs.name: varProject
inputs.label: Project
inputs.helpMarkDown: The ALM project in which the tests to run are stored

inputs.name: varEnvId
inputs.label: AUT Environment ID
inputs.helpMarkDown: Assign ID of an AUT Environment that exists in the ALM project you selected

inputs.name: javaHomeSelection
inputs.label: Choose your configuration type:
inputs.helpMarkDown: Sets JAVA_HOME either by selecting a JDK version that will be discovered during builds or by manually entering a JDK path

inputs.name: createNewNamed
inputs.label: New configuration name:
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name for the configuration to be created

inputs.name: jdkUserInputPath
inputs.label: Configuration ID:
inputs.helpMarkDown: Sets JAVA_HOME to the given path

inputs.name: varPathToJSON
inputs.label: Path to JSON File
inputs.helpMarkDown: A path to the JSON file that will be loaded in order to assign values to all the AUT Environment Parameters of From JSON type

inputs.name: paramType1
inputs.label: Parameter Type
inputs.helpMarkDown: Manual - the value you will assign for 'Parameter value' field will be used as it is. Environment - the Parameter Value you will assign will be looked for in the environment parameters and the resolved value will be used (If you named your parameter MY_PARAMETER, use the exact the same value here - MY_PARAMETER). JSON - the Parameter Value will be looked for in the JSON file you specified in the the 'Path to JSON' field

inputs.name: paramName1
inputs.label: Parameter Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name must be set in the same hierarchical structure as it is defined in ALM (Parameters tab of the AUT Environment). For example: Parameters/Parameter_name

inputs.name: paramValue1
inputs.label: Parameter Value
inputs.helpMarkDown: If you are using a From JSON type, specify here the path for the element you would like to get. Make sure you are using JsonPath style for defining it
